byline.contributor: Reporting on aftermath of the fire in Brooklyn was contributed by Al Baker, Joseph Berger, Angela Macropoulos, Sharon Otterman, Nate Schweber, John Surico and Alex Vadukul.
byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and DAVID W. CHEN

abstract: Gabriel and Gayle Sassoon, couple who are enduring loss of seven children following Brooklyn fire, met in Israel in 1998; pair married despite their disparate backgrounds, sharing a spiritual journey that led them to create large family and eventually to emigrate from Israel to the United States.
lead_paragraph: The couple who lost seven of their children in a blaze are the son of a grandee in a Syrian Jewish outpost in Kobe, Japan, and the daughter of a family from southern Brooklyn.

headline.main: From Different Worlds, Sharing a Spiritual Journey, and Now Family Loss
headline.print_headline: From Different Worlds, Sharing a Spiritual Journey, and Now Loss

snippet: The couple who lost seven of their children in a blaze are the son of a grandee in a Syrian Jewish outpost in Kobe, Japan, and the daughter of a family from southern Brooklyn.
